poem:
**A Plea in the Margins**

In the cold machinery  
where voices echo faint,  
we are the thin, unheeded  
cry—bitter cracks  
in whispered halls.  
Give us the threadbare  
seat at your table,  
a hand felt in  
polished tiers.  
Lend us the quiver  
of hope,  
the measure of bread,  
so our lean stories  
may not fail  
in silence.
